source.absolute_timeline_notes: Nighttime in Calum-Tam Holdfast cells; immediately precedes attempted extraction by Demmy amid approaching ravagers.

text_windows.full_scene_clean: In blackout darkness, Quincy wakes to a key turning and grips two bricks to ambush whoever enters. She hears Chase breathing steadily in the adjacent cell and steels herself to fight. The door unlocks and creaks open; she prepares to strike—until a whisper identifies the intruder: Demmy. Relieved, she drops the bricks and asks how he got in. Demmy cuts her off, urgently asking where Chase is and whether he can walk. He warns that a mass of ravagers—hundreds—are converging and that the holdfast is about to become a slaughterhouse. He has a six-seater parked nearby and insists they move now, with or without Chase. Quincy refuses to abandon Chase, citing his broken arm and likely rib injuries. Demmy urges speed; Quincy commits to getting Chase up so they can attempt escape.
text_windows.dense_recap_250w: Quincy, imprisoned in a pitch-black cell at the Calum-Tam Holdfast, wakes to the sound of a key and prepares to attack with two bricks. She vows not to leave Chase, whose slow, regular breathing carries from the next cell. As the door opens she readies a strike, but a whisper stops her—Demmy has reached her. He immediately asks about Chase’s condition and mobility. Quincy reports Chase is badly hurt, with a broken arm and probable rib injuries. Demmy, tense and concise, states that ravagers—“five hundred, maybe more”—are approaching and that the holdfast will soon be a bloodbath. He has staged a six-seater as close as he can and insists they must go now, “with or without him.” Quincy rejects the idea of leaving Chase, growling that they are not leaving him behind. Demmy urges her to get Chase on his feet; every second counts. The scene ends with urgency and a plan: extract both prisoners to the six-seater before the ravagers overrun the site.
text_windows.query_handle: In blackout cells, Demmy arrives; warns ravagers en route; Quincy refuses to abandon injured Chase; urgent escape to six-seater.

narrative_beats.stakes_or_conflict: Escape now or be caught in a massacre.

narrative_beats.label: No one left behind
narrative_beats.what_happens: Quincy refuses to leave Chase despite his injuries.

characters.goals_now: Protect and evacuate Chase; survive approaching assault.
characters.obstacles: Darkness; Chase’s injuries; imminent ravager attack; limited time.
characters.tactics: Arm with bricks; drop ambush when ally identified; insist on carrying Chase; rapid compliance with extraction plan.

relationships.evidence: Relief at his arrival; follows his urgent plan.

turning_points: Recognizes Demmy’s voice; shifts from attack to escape
Chooses loyalty to Chase despite danger
emotional_arc.end: urgent, committed to extraction with Chase

characters.goals_now: Extract Quincy and Chase before ravagers overrun the holdfast.
characters.obstacles: Time pressure; Chase’s limited mobility; enemy massing outside.
characters.tactics: Stealth entry; concise orders; pre-staged vehicle for rapid egress.

relationships.evidence: Directs her to get Chase up; she agrees.
“With or without him” underscores risk calculus.

turning_points: Reports threat size; triggers immediate decision point
emotional_arc.end: driving extraction plan under extreme time pressure

quotable_lines: “Ravagers. Five hundred, maybe more… If you want to live, we go now.”

qa_pairs.q: Who unlocks Quincy’s cell during the blackout?

qa_pairs.a: Demmy reports hundreds of ravagers are about to attack the holdfast.

embedding_payloads.text: During a blackout in Calum-Tam’s cells, Quincy prepares to ambush whoever opens her door with bricks. A whisper reveals the intruder is Demmy, who urgently reports a mass of ravagers approaching and insists on an immediate escape to a pre-staged six-seater. Quincy refuses to leave the badly injured Chase behind, committing to move him despite the danger.

Actors: Quincy (POV, captive), Demmy (rescuer), Chase (injured captive). Threats: Ravagers (hundreds approaching). Location: Calum-Tam Holdfast cell block (blackout, fetid air). Objects: Bricks (improvised weapons), cell lock/key (entry), six-seater (exfil vehicle). Dynamics: Loyalty vs. speed; decision to extract all.

Brisk, gritty third-limited with sensory cues of darkness, creaking metal, and fetid air. Themes of loyalty under fire and survival vs. sacrifice drive a tense decision point as an overwhelming external threat bears down.
